snippet: The Newsday writer Paul Moran, who died of lung cancer in November, instructed that his remains be scattered in the infield at Saratoga Race Course.
abstract: Postcard From Saratoga Springs; Newsday writer Paul Moran, who died of lung cancer in November 2013, instructed that his remains be scattered in the infield at Saratoga Race Course; journalists and press agents, gamblers and assorted characters whose exact dealings are unknown but who are part of the vital, frayed, always colorful quilt of racetrack life, gather to remember him.
lead_paragraph: The Newsday writer Paul Moran, who died of lung cancer in November, instructed that his remains be scattered in the infield at Saratoga Race Course.

headline.main: Postcard From Saratoga Springs: Eternal Rest at a Shrine He Enlivened
headline.print_headline: An Eternal Rest at a Shrine He Enlivened
